CREATE TABLE Volunteers (
    volunteer_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    volunteer_name VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE,
    phone_number VARCHAR(15),
    registration_date TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE Projects (
    project_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    project_name VARCHAR(100),
    project_description TEXT,
    start_date TIMESTAMP,
    end_date TIMESTAMP,
    coordinator_id UUID,
    FOREIGN KEY (coordinator_id) REFERENCES Volunteers(volunteer_id)
);

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE Volunteers (
	volunteer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
	email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE,
	phone_number VARCHAR(20),
	availability BOOLEAN
);


CREATE TABLE Projects (
	project_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	project_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
	description TEXT,
	location VARCHAR(100),
	start_date DATE,
	end_date DATE
);


CREATE TABLE Assignments (
	assignment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	volunteer_id INT,
	project_id INT,
	assignment_date DATE,
	assignment_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'Pending',
	FOREIGN KEY (volunteer_id) REFERENCES Volunteers (volunteer_id),
	FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES Projects (project_id)
);


CREATE TABLE Tasks (
	task_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	project_id INT,
	task_description TEXT,
	due_date DATE,
	assigned_to INT,
	task_status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'Pending',
	FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES Projects (project_id),
	FOREIGN KEY (assigned_to) REFERENCES Volunteers (volunteer_id)
);

    name VARCHAR(255),
    email VARCHAR(255),

);

    project_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    project_name VARCHAR(255),
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE
);


CREATE TABLE volunteer_projects (
    volunteer_id INT,
    project_id INT,
    PRIMARY KEY (volunteer_id, project_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (volunteer_id) REFERENCES volunteers(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES projects(project_id)
);

    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    project_id INT,
    volunteer_id INT,
    date DATE,
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME,
    FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES projects(project_id),

);


CREATE TABLE tasks (

    task_description TEXT,
    project_id INT,
    volunteer_id INT,
    completion_status BOOLEAN,
    FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES projects(project_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (volunteer_id) REFERENCES volunteers(id)
);
